intro: Eriocephalus glaber, commonly known as the smooth eriocephalus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a woody stem with narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, making it a notable ornamental plant. It is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
